poem:
Blooms at the Border

In the garden of politics,
petals once passed, now pricked  
on thorns of red tape. 
A rose from Holland,
a lily from France,
halted at the threshold—
strangers in bloom,
awaiting the kiss
of distant sun. 
Here, in our isled soil,
we wait for color  
that may never return.
